alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Greensville; Prince George; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Greensville, western Prince George, western Sussex and eastern Dinwiddie Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 345 PM EDT... At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dinwiddie to near Purdy. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Fort Lee, Purdy, Virginia State University, Sussex, Jarratt, Stony Creek, Dewitt, Matoaca, Ettrick, Carson, Addison, Booker, Yale, Wharfs Store, Petersburg National Battlefield and Cowie Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Greensville; Prince George; Sussex
